derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the general sense Italian): via Latin from Greek Italikos, from Italia 'Italy'. Senses relating to writing date from the early 17th cent

entry.def: Italics are letters which slope to the right. Italics are often used to emphasize a particular word or sentence. The examples in this dictionary are printed in italics.
Italic letters slope to the right.

example.ex: She addressed them by hand in her beautiful italic script.
example.tran: 她用漂亮的斜体字写明了收信人姓名和地址。

means.word_mean: 1. a style of handwriting with the letters slanting to the right
2. a typeface with letters slanting upward to the right
